ground_truth: His face contorts in agony, and he grabs his stomach and turns toward Elsa as he starts to age rapidly, with his hair growing long, gray, and brittle. Elsa gasps and screams while his skin turns brown, leathery, and stretches across his bones until it splits. His skeletal hands reach for Elsa's throat, choking her, and Indy rushes forward to push Donovan away. As Donovan falls, his body breaks into flames and shatters against the wall. Indy studies the array of chalices and picks up another cup, a simple earthenware jug. He and Elsa exchange a look, and Indy goes to the well, fills the jug with water, and pauses before bringing it to his lips and taking several large swallows. Indy and Elsa come forward with the Grail, and the two Nazi soldiers are overawed by the possessors of the Grail. Indy kneels by Henry's side, tilts his head forward, and holds the Grail to his lips, but Henry is too weak to open his eyes. Henry swallows some of the water, though much of it runs down the corners of his mouth. Finally, Indy pours the water over the wound, and everyone watches in astonishment as the wound and bloodstain disappear. The color returns to Henry's face, his eyes open, and they first light up at the sight of the Grail and then even more at Indy’s face. Nazi soldiers run forward but drop their weapons and surrender. Elsa steps forward, picks up the Grail, and turns to Indy, her face alight with possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, a rumbling sound is heard, and the ground roars and shifts. Dirt falls from the ceiling of the cavern, Elsa falls on the Great Seal, and the Grail bounces away from her grasp. She reaches for it as the ground beneath her begins to split open, slipping into the crevasse. As her hands lose their grip, Indy manages to grab one, sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to get the Grail with her free hand, Indy can't save her unless she gives him her free hand, but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on begins to break apart, Henry grabs his hand as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy abandons the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands, and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other, and Sallah and Brody rush from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: His visage contorts in torment, and he seizes his abdomen and turns toward Elsa as he starts to age swiftly, with his hair growing long, gray, and frail. Elsa gasps and screams while his skin turns brown, leathery, and stretches across his bones until it splits. His skeletal hands reach for Elsa's throat, choking her, and Indy dashes forward to shove Donovan away. As Donovan falls, his body ignites into flames and shatters against the wall. Indy examines the selection of chalices and picks up another cup, a simple earthenware pitcher. He and Elsa exchange a look, and Indy goes to the well, fills the jug with water, and pauses before bringing it to his lips and taking several large gulps. Indy and Elsa come forward with the Grail, and the two Nazi soldiers are overawed by the possessors of the Grail. Indy kneels by Henry's side, tilts his head forward, and holds the Grail to his lips, but Henry is too frail to open his eyes. Henry swallows some of the water, though much of it runs down the corners of his mouth. Finally, Indy pours the water over the wound, and everyone watches in amazement as the wound and bloodstain vanish. The color returns to Henry's face, his eyes open, and they first illuminate at the sight of the Grail and then even more at Indy’s face. Nazi soldiers charge forward but drop their arms and capitulate. Elsa steps forward, picks up the Grail, and turns to Indy, her face alight with possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, a rumbling noise is heard, and the ground roars and shifts. Dirt falls from the ceiling of the cavern, Elsa falls on the Great Seal, and the Grail bounces away from her grasp. She reaches for it as the ground beneath her begins to split open, slipping into the chasm. As her hands lose their grip, Indy manages to grab one, sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to get the Grail with her free hand, Indy can't rescue her unless she gives him her free hand, but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on begins to break apart, Henry grabs his hand as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy abandons the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands, and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling rubble at each other, and Sallah and Brody dash from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: His face is contorted in agony, and his stomach is grabbed by him before he is turned toward Elsa as aging rapidly starts, with his hair being grown long, gray, and brittle. Elsa gasps and screams while his skin is turned brown, leathery, and is stretched across his bones until it splits. Elsa's throat is reached for by his skeletal hands, and she is choked while forward is rushed by Indy to push Donovan away. As he falls, flames break Donovan's body, and it is shattered against the wall. The array of chalices is studied by Indy, and another cup is picked up by him, a simple earthenware jug. A look is exchanged by him and Elsa, and the well is approached by Indy, who fills the jug with water and pauses before it is brought to his lips and several large swallows are taken. The Grail is brought forward by Indy and Elsa, and the two Nazi soldiers are overawed by the possessors of the Grail. Henry’s side is kneeled by Indy, his head is tilted forward, and the Grail is held to his lips, but his eyes are not opened by Henry due to weakness. Some of the water is swallowed by Henry, though much of it runs down the corners of his mouth. Finally, the water is poured by Indy over the wound, and astonishment is felt by everyone as the wound and bloodstain disappear. Color is returned to Henry's face, his eyes are opened, and they first light up at the sight of the Grail and then even more at the sight of Indy’s face. Nazi soldiers run forward but weapons are dropped by them and surrender is given. Indy is turned to by Elsa, who steps forward, picks up the Grail, and her face is alight with possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, a rumbling sound is heard, and the ground is roared and shifted. Dirt is fallen from the ceiling of the cavern, Elsa falls on the Great Seal, and the Grail is bounced away from her grasp. It is reached for by her as open ground beneath her begins to split, slipping into the crevasse. Her grip loses its strength, and one hand is managed to be grabbed by Indy, who slides forward across the slanted floor. While the Grail is tried to be gotten by Elsa with her free hand, she cannot be saved by Indy unless her free hand is given to him, but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. Henry grabs Indy's hand as the ledge he lies on begins to break apart while the Grail with the other is struggled to be reached by Indy. The Grail is abandoned by Indy and Henry is grabbed onto with both hands, and up to safety Indy is pulled by Henry. They look through the falling debris at each other, and the crumbling Temple is rushed from by Sallah and Brody.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: His face contorts in agony as he clutches his stomach and turns to Elsa, rapidly aging with long, gray, brittle hair. Elsa gasps as his skin turns brown and leathery, stretching until it splits. His skeletal hands choke Elsa, and Indy pushes Donovan away. Donovan falls, ignites, and shatters against the wall. Indy examines the chalices, choosing a simple earthenware jug. He and Elsa exchange a look, and Indy fills the jug with water, pausing before drinking. Indy and Elsa present the Grail, awing the Nazi soldiers. Indy kneels by Henry, tilts his head, and offers the Grail, but Henry is too weak to open his eyes. Henry swallows some water, and Indy pours it over his wound, which miraculously heals. Color returns to Henry's face, and his eyes light up at the Grail and Indy. Nazi soldiers surrender. Elsa picks up the Grail, her face alight with possession. She steps onto the Great Seal, causing a rumble and ground shift. Dirt falls, Elsa falls, and the Grail slips away. She reaches for it as the ground splits, slipping into the crevasse. Indy grabs her hand, but she tries to reach the Grail, causing her hand to slip. As the ledge breaks, Henry grabs Indy, who abandons the Grail to hold onto Henry. Henry pulls Indy to safety, and they look at each other through the debris as Sallah and Brody flee the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: His face contorts in agony as he grabs his stomach, aging rapidly with long, gray hair. Elsa gasps as his skin turns brown and leathery, splitting over his bones. His skeletal hands choke Elsa, and Indy pushes Donovan away. Donovan falls, ignites, and shatters. Indy selects a simple jug, fills it with water, and drinks. Indy and Elsa present the Grail, awing Nazi soldiers. Indy kneels by Henry, giving him water, which heals his wound. Henry's color returns, and his eyes light up at the Grail and Indy. Nazi soldiers surrender. Elsa picks up the Grail, steps onto the Great Seal, causing the ground to shift. She falls, losing the Grail, and reaches for it as the ground splits. Indy grabs her hand, but she tries to reach the Grail, slipping from his grasp. As the ledge breaks, Henry grabs Indy, who abandons the Grail to hold onto Henry. Henry pulls Indy to safety, and they escape the crumbling Temple with Sallah and Brody.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: His face twists and contorts in sheer agony, and he clutches his stomach tightly, turning toward Elsa as he begins to age at an alarming rate. His hair grows long, turning gray and brittle, as if time itself is speeding up. Elsa gasps in shock and lets out a scream while his skin transforms, becoming brown and leathery, stretching tautly across his bones until it splits apart. His skeletal hands reach out menacingly for Elsa's throat, attempting to choke her, and Indy quickly rushes forward to push Donovan away. As Donovan falls, his body erupts into flames and shatters dramatically against the wall. Indy then turns his attention to the array of chalices, carefully studying them before picking up another cup, which is a simple earthenware jug. He and Elsa exchange a meaningful look, and Indy proceeds to the well, fills the jug with water, and pauses momentarily before bringing it to his lips and taking several large, deliberate swallows. Indy and Elsa advance with the Grail in hand, and the two Nazi soldiers are left overawed by the presence of the Grail's possessors. Indy kneels by Henry's side, gently tilts his head forward, and holds the Grail to his lips, but Henry is too weak to open his eyes. Henry manages to swallow some of the water, though much of it trickles down the corners of his mouth. Finally, Indy pours the water over the wound, and everyone watches in astonishment as the wound and bloodstain miraculously disappear. The color returns to Henry's face, his eyes open, and they first light up at the sight of the Grail and then even more at the sight of Indy’s face. Nazi soldiers rush forward but, overwhelmed by the moment, drop their weapons and surrender. Elsa steps forward, picks up the Grail, and turns to Indy, her face alight with the thrill of possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, and a rumbling sound is heard as the ground begins to roar and shift. Dirt falls from the ceiling of the cavern, and Elsa falls onto the Great Seal, causing the Grail to bounce away from her grasp. She desperately reaches for it as the ground beneath her starts to split open, slipping into the widening crevasse. As her hands lose their grip, Indy manages to grab one, sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to reach the Grail with her free hand, Indy realizes he can't save her unless she gives him her free hand, but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on starts to break apart, Henry grabs his hand as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy makes the difficult decision to abandon the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands, and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other, and Sallah and Brody rush out from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: His face contorts and twists in sheer, unbearable agony, and he desperately clutches his stomach with both hands, turning toward Elsa as he begins to age at an unnaturally alarming rate. His hair grows long, turning a grayish color, brittle as if time itself is accelerating at an unnatural speed. Elsa gasps audibly in shock and lets out a piercing scream as his skin undergoes a transformation, turning brown and leathery, stretching tightly across his bones until it gruesomely splits apart. His skeletal, bony hands reach out in a menacing attempt for Elsa's throat, trying to choke her. In response, Indy quickly rushes forward with urgency to push Donovan away. As Donovan falls backward, his body erupts into flames and dramatically shatters against the hard wall. Indy then turns his attention to the array of chalices displayed before him, carefully and thoughtfully studying them before he decides on another cup, which is a simple, unassuming earthenware jug. He and Elsa exchange a meaningful, knowing look, and then Indy proceeds to the well, filling the jug with water. He pauses momentarily, contemplating, before bringing it to his lips and taking several large, deliberate swallows. Indy and Elsa advance with the Grail securely in hand, and the two Nazi soldiers are left speechless and overawed by the overwhelming presence of the Grail's possessors. Indy kneels beside Henry, gently tilting his head forward, and holds the Grail tenderly to his lips. Henry, too weak to open his eyes fully, manages to swallow some of the healing water, though much of it trickles down the corners of his mouth. Finally, Indy pours the water over the wound, and everyone watches in utter astonishment as the wound and bloodstain miraculously vanish. The color returns to Henry's face, his eyes open, and they first light up with amazement at the sight of the Grail and then even more with joy at the sight of Indy’s face. The Nazi soldiers rush forward, but overwhelmed by the awe of the moment, they drop their weapons and surrender without resistance. Elsa steps forward eagerly, picks up the Grail, and turns to Indy, her entire face alight with the thrill and excitement of possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, and a rumbling sound echoes ominously as the ground beneath them begins to roar and shift. Dirt and debris fall from the cavern ceiling above, and Elsa falls abruptly onto the Great Seal, causing the Grail to bounce away from her grasp. She desperately reaches for it as the ground beneath her feet starts to split open, slipping into the widening crevasse. As her hands begin to lose their grip, Indy manages to grab one of her hands, sliding forward precariously across the slanted floor. As Elsa tries to reach the elusive Grail with her free hand, Indy realizes that he cannot save her unless she lets go and offers him her free hand, but her hand begins to slip from his weakening grasp. As the ledge on which Indy lies starts to break apart under the strain, Henry grabs his hand, rescuing him as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with his other hand. Indy makes the difficult, heart-wrenching decision to abandon the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands, who then pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other with relieved expressions, and Sallah and Brody rush out from the collapsing, crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: His face contorts in agony, each muscle tightening and twisting as he clutches his stomach with a desperate grip, turning toward Elsa with a look of panic and pain. As he begins to age rapidly, his hair grows long, turning gray and brittle, each strand losing its youthful luster. Elsa gasps, her eyes widening in horror, and she lets out a scream as his skin transforms, becoming brown and leathery, stretching tautly across his bones until it splits with a sickening sound. His skeletal hands, now devoid of flesh, reach out with a menacing intent toward Elsa's throat, wrapping around it in a choking grasp. In a swift motion, Indy rushes forward, his feet pounding against the ground, and he pushes Donovan away with all his might. As Donovan falls, his body ignites into flames, the fire consuming him rapidly, and he shatters against the wall, leaving nothing but ashes. Indy turns his attention to the array of chalices, his eyes scanning each one carefully before he picks up another cup, a simple earthenware jug that stands out in its plainness. He and Elsa exchange a meaningful look, a silent understanding passing between them, and Indy moves to the well, dipping the jug into the water, watching as it fills. He pauses for a moment, contemplating the significance of his actions, before bringing the jug to his lips and taking several large swallows, feeling the cool liquid flow down his throat. Indy and Elsa step forward, holding the Grail with a sense of reverence, and the two Nazi soldiers stand in awe, their eyes wide with disbelief at the sight of the Grail's possessors. Indy kneels by Henry's side, gently tilting his head forward, and carefully holds the Grail to his lips, though Henry is too weak to open his eyes. As Henry swallows some of the water, much of it trickles down the corners of his mouth, but Indy remains patient. Finally, Indy pours the water over Henry's wound, and everyone watches in astonishment as the wound and bloodstain miraculously disappear. The color returns to Henry's face, his eyes flutter open, and they light up first at the sight of the Grail and then even more brightly at the sight of Indy's face. The Nazi soldiers, realizing the futility of their situation, run forward but quickly drop their weapons and surrender. Elsa steps forward with determination, picking up the Grail, her face alight with the thrill of possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, and a rumbling sound echoes through the cavern as the ground begins to roar and shift beneath her feet. Dirt cascades from the ceiling, and Elsa falls onto the Great Seal, the Grail bouncing away from her grasp. Desperately, she reaches for it as the ground beneath her starts to split open, slipping into the widening crevasse. Her hands lose their grip, and Indy, with a quick reflex, manages to grab one, sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to reach the Grail with her free hand, Indy realizes he can't save her unless she gives him her free hand, but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on starts to break apart, Henry reaches out and grabs Indy's hand, providing a lifeline as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Realizing the futility, Indy abandons the Grail and clutches onto Henry with both hands, allowing Henry to pull him up to safety. They exchange a look through the falling debris, a moment of relief and understanding passing between them, as Sallah and Brody rush out from the crumbling Temple, escaping the chaos.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Donovan's face contorts in agony as he rapidly ages, his hair turning long, gray, and brittle. Elsa gasps and screams while his skin becomes brown and leathery, stretching until it splits. His skeletal hands reach for Elsa's throat, choking her, prompting Indy to rush forward and push Donovan away. As Donovan falls, his body ignites and shatters against the wall. Indy examines the chalices, selects a simple earthenware jug, and exchanges a look with Elsa before filling it with water and drinking. Indy and Elsa present the Grail, leaving the Nazi soldiers awestruck. Indy kneels by Henry, tilts his head, and offers the Grail, but Henry is too weak to open his eyes. Henry swallows some water, and Indy pours it over his wound, astonishing everyone as the wound heals and color returns to Henry's face. His eyes open, lighting up at the sight of the Grail and even more at Indy. The Nazi soldiers surrender, dropping their weapons. Elsa, her face alight with possession, picks up the Grail and steps onto the Great Seal. A rumbling sound ensues, the ground shifts, and Elsa falls, losing the Grail as the ground splits open beneath her. Indy grabs her hand as she reaches for the Grail, but her grip slips. As the ledge begins to break apart, Henry grabs Indy's hand, and Indy abandons the Grail to hold onto Henry with both hands, who pulls him to safety. They exchange a look through the falling debris as Sallah and Brody rush from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: His face contorts in agony, reminiscent of the victims of the ancient curses, and he grabs his stomach and turns toward Elsa as he starts to age rapidly, with his hair growing long, gray, and brittle like an accelerated time-lapse of a human life. Elsa gasps and screams, echoing the shock of witnessing something supernatural, while his skin turns brown, leathery, and stretches across his bones until it splits, resembling ancient Egyptian mummies discovered in the Valley of the Kings. His skeletal hands, reminiscent of the grim remains found in catacombs, reach for Elsa's throat, choking her, and Indy, drawing upon his experience in perilous archaeological adventures, rushes forward to push Donovan away. As Donovan falls, his body breaks into flames, reminiscent of the legends of spontaneous human combustion, and shatters against the wall. Indy studies the array of chalices, much like the historical Holy Grail collection searches throughout history, and picks up another cup, a simple earthenware jug resembling those used in the early centuries. He and Elsa exchange a look, sharing an understanding of the artifact's significance, and Indy goes to the well, an ancient symbol of life’s sustenance, fills the jug with water, and pauses before bringing it to his lips and taking several large swallows. Indy and Elsa come forward with the Grail, an artifact long pursued by collectors and historians, and the two Nazi soldiers are overawed by the possessors of the Grail, an object of unimaginable power. Indy kneels by Henry's side, tilts his head forward, and holds the Grail to his lips, but Henry is too weak to open his eyes, much like accounts of exhausted explorers who finally find sanctuary. Henry swallows some of the water, though much of it runs down the corners of his mouth. Finally, Indy pours the water over the wound, reminiscent of miraculous healing tales from religious texts, and everyone watches in astonishment as the wound and bloodstain disappear. The color returns to Henry's face, his eyes open, and they first light up at the sight of the Grail, symbolizing hope and salvation, and then even more at Indy’s face. Nazi soldiers, who had moments ago symbolized the brutal force of occupation, run forward but drop their weapons and surrender, recognizing the power shift. Elsa steps forward, picks up the Grail, driven by ambition, and turns to Indy, her face alight with possession, similar to explorers who have finally reached their coveted treasure. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal, an ancient barrier not to be crossed, a rumbling sound is heard, and the ground roars and shifts. Dirt falls from the ceiling of the cavern, reminiscent of ancient tales where greed leads to one's downfall, Elsa falls on the Great Seal, and the Grail bounces away from her grasp. She reaches for it as the ground beneath her begins to split open, slipping into the crevasse, a common consequence in myth for those who overreach. As her hands lose their grip, Indy manages to grab one, sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to get the Grail with her free hand, Indy can't save her unless she gives him her free hand, but her hand begins to slip from his grasp like many tragic heroes who can't let go of their desires. As the ledge Indy lies on begins to break apart, Henry grabs his hand with the determination of a father who refuses to lose his son as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy abandons the Grail, an act symbolizing the relinquishment of material desires, and grabs onto Henry with both hands, and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other, sharing a moment of profound connection and relief, and Sallah and Brody, loyal companions in their quest, rush from the crumbling Temple, a victim of greed and ambition.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. While Elsa tries to get the Grail with her free hand Indy cannot save her unless she gives him her free hand but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on begins to break apart. Henry grabs his hand as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy abandons the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other and Sallah and Brody rush from the crumbling Temple.

Elsa steps forward picks up the Grail and turns to Indy her face alight with possession. She steps onto the edge of the Great Seal. a rumbling sound is heard and the ground roars and shifts. Dirt falls from the ceiling of the cavern. Elsa falls on the Great Seal and the Grail bounces away from her grasp. She reaches for it as the ground beneath her begins to split open slipping into the crevasse. As her hands lose their grip Indy manages to grab one sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to get the Grail with her free hand Indy cannot save her unless she gives him her free hand but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on begins to break apart. Henry grabs his hand as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy abandons the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other and Sallah and Brody rush from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: His face contorts in agony and he grabs his stomach and turns toward Elsa as he starts to age rapidly with his hair growing long gray and brittle. Elsa gasps and screams while his skin turns brown leathery and stretches across his bones until it splits. His skeletal hands reach for Elsa's throat choking her and Indy rushes forward to push Donovan away. As Donovan falls his body breaks into flames and shatters against the wall. Indy studies the array of chalices and picks up another cup a simple earthenware jug. He and Elsa exchange a look and Indy goes to the well fills the jug with water and pauses before bringing it to his lips and taking several large swallows. As her hands lose their grip Indy manages to grab one sliding forward across the slanted floor. While Elsa tries to get the Grail with her free hand Indy cannot save her unless she gives him her free hand but her hand begins to slip from his grasp. As the ledge Indy lies on begins to break apart. Henry grabs his hand as Indy struggles to reach the Grail with the other. Indy abandons the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other and Sallah and Brody rush from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: His face contorts in agony and he grabs his stomach and turns toward Elsa as he starts to age rapidly with his hair growing long gray and brittle. Elsa gasps and screams while his skin turns brown leathery and stretches across his bones until it splits. His skeletal hands reach for Elsa's throat choking her and Indy rushes forward to push Donovan away. Indy abandons the Grail and grabs onto Henry with both hands and Henry pulls him up to safety. They look through the falling debris at each other and Sallah and Brody rush from the crumbling Temple.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: His expression twists in delight, and he pats his head and spins toward Carlos as he starts to shrink slowly, with his beard growing short, blond, and silky. Carlos chuckles and cheers while his skin turns green, smooth, and wraps around his muscles until it glows. His furry feet reach for Carlos's shoulder, hugging him, and Alex strolls backward to pull Nathan closer. As Nathan rises, his shoes burst into bubbles and scatter across the floor. Alex surveys the line of goblets and picks up another bowl, a fancy plastic vessel. He and Carlos exchange a grin, and Alex goes to the fountain, fills the vessel with juice, and hesitates before bringing it to his nose and sniffing deeply. Alex and Carlos step backward with the Spoon, and the two merchant sailors are amused by the guardians of the Spoon. Alex crouches by George's feet, raises his arm upward, and places the Spoon on his knees, but George is too sleepy to lift his eyebrows. George tastes some of the juice, though much of it dribbles down the sides of his chin. Eventually, Alex spills the juice over the scratch, and everyone stares in confusion as the scratch and bruise vanish. The glow returns to George's hands, his eyebrows lift, and they first brighten at the sight of the Spoon and then even more at Alex’s smile. Merchant sailors stroll backward but pick up their helmets and flee. Carlos steps backward, picks up the Spoon, and spins to Alex, her expression aglow with fascination. She steps onto the center of the Small Mark, a whispering sound is heard, and the ceiling echoes and sways. Sand rises from the floor of the tunnel, Carlos rises on the Small Mark, and the Spoon rolls toward her feet. She kicks for it as the ceiling above her starts to crack open, rolling into the fissure. As her elbows lose their hold, Alex manages to kick one, rolling backward across the tilted ceiling. While Carlos tries to grab the Spoon with her free elbow, Alex can’t save her unless she offers him her free elbow, but her elbow starts to pull from his grip. As the surface Alex stands on starts to crumble, George grasps his elbow as Alex struggles to drop the Spoon with the other. Alex releases the Spoon and clings onto George with both elbows, and George lifts him down to danger. They glance through the rising sand at each other, and Trevor and Mandy stroll into the solid Cave.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As his face contorts in agony and he rapidly ages, Donovan's hair turns gray and his skin leathery. Reaching for Elsa's throat, Indy intervenes, pushing Donovan, who bursts into flames. Indy then selects a simple cup, fills it with water, and drinks. Bringing the Grail to Henry, Indy pours its water over Henry's wound, healing him. As Nazi soldiers surrender, Elsa takes the Grail, triggering a tremor. She falls onto the Great Seal, losing her grip on the Grail as the ground splits. Indy manages to grab Elsa's hand, but her obsession with the Grail leads her to slip into the crevasse. As the ledge crumbles, Henry catches Indy, who chooses to abandon the Grail to escape with his father. They reunite amid the falling debris as Sallah and Brody flee the collapsing Temple.
